result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua M Otto

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua M Otto in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #16CF681.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 19, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Joshua M Otto did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weathers requests a further proceeding hearing after Motion set on Defendant's other case (2016CF000681). Motion is set for 11/28/16. Court sets for jury trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests case be adjourned to a date after court date on Case #16CF681.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests this case be adjourned to a date after Defendant's other case with Attorney Kuchler.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weathers states that the Defendant has another case and is requesting another hearing date.  This case and 16CF473 to be set together for further proceeding. Defendant's newest case of 16CF681 has been assigned to Atty Donna Kuchler as Atty Weathers has a conflict. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Joshua M Otto did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant called earlier today stating that there was a death in the family and cannot be here today.    Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Bail remains as fixed.  NOTE:  Defendant to provide proof of death of grandfather.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on April 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests a plea date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Hearing at 03-14-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjourned date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
